result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R Houle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph R Houle is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph R Houle was found guilty of Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine has been paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Final stipulation signed by DA and Attorney Kennedy
Jury trial on June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph R Houle in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:58 AM. Judge Bloom and his court reporter appear via telephone from Oneida County. Court summarizes case, both counsel agree as summarized. Court has read the motion and memorandum in support of motion, goes thru motion, denies motion to dismiss for stated reasons. Court continues bond and needs to set the matter for JT again. State believes that a minimum of two days is required for trial. Kennedy agrees. Court sets for 2 day JT, continues bond. If counsel things MIL will be necessary, counsel to contact JA Shawl for a motion date.  Jury trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion and Order for Adjournment - Approved

Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance - CoVantage Credit Union
letter from Ultimate Rides to Kennedy Law Office regarding the 4 pm hearing scheduled on 12/30/15.

Defendant Joseph R Houle in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:15 pm. Kennedy makes statement as what status is. Wants vehcile brought into jurisdiction of the court. Wants order from the court. State responds - no need for the vehicle and believes that Kennedy would have to petition the court and file the proper paperwork. Court responds. Kennedy makes further statements. State responds and makes statement. State will try and assist. Court instructs Kennedy to contact his JA for about 60 days out for continued PTC. 15 days for return date on subpoena and can be held in Rhinelander.

Pre-trial conference at 12-14-2015 11:45 am.
Jury trial at 03-15-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph R Houle in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:04 AM. Court - set for PTC. Kennedy - still trying to get instrument panel, updates Court on that. State responds - updates court, discovery has gone out. Court instructs Kennedy to follow up on his part regarding what he needs. State has no objections to defense flushing information out and would like court to set for JT and possible PTC. Court not foreclosing defense to get the evidence needed but need to set the matter for further proceedings. State can inquire from FOSO if a check can be run off VIN. Court continues bond and sets for another PTC and JT, gives warnings of getting all needed information so case can move forward. Court prefers a hearing date if it is something that is going to require a court order.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 11:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from Kennedy to COC re: Application/Order

Defendant Joseph R Houle in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:50 PM. Court - we are set for ARGN today, Information has been filed. Kennedy has Information, waives reading, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts NG pleas. Court was informed that Kennedy said today was also the date and time for a motion hearing and witnesses were subpoenaed today and reviews documents filed. Kennedy responds and states that he has filed the motion for stated reasons. Court - not going to hear the motion today for stated reasons (971.31). Court was not put on notice of the motion hearing today. Court will set this matter for a motion hearing some time after today. Kennedy asking that he be allowed to submit documents brought to court today. State objects - not proper. Court will not be taking testimony today and will so when the motion is properly noticed. Kennedy asks if the witnesses can give him the documents that he requested. Court - between Kennedy and the witnesses. Kennedy can file a notice of motion if he wants it earlier but will have to file it.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
BB (Rhinelander Auto Center) - Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance
JL - Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance
#1 original title, #2 registration, #4 odometer history report. Exhibits #3, 5 & 6 offered but not rec'vd by the court.

Defendant Joseph R Houle in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:57 PM. Kennedy asks for sequestration of witnesses. Court sequestors witnesses - record reflects two of State's witnesses  State calls Kadie Montgomery. Montgomery sworn in at 3:59 PM. Direct exam by State. State offers exhibit #1 - Original Title of vehicle. Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (4:05 PM). State offers exhibit #2 - registration of vehicle. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (4:07 PM). Kennedy objects - hearsay - overruled (4:10 PM). State objects - relavence - overruled (4:16 PM). State objects - relavence - sustained (4:16 PM). State objects - relavence - sustained (4:17 PM). State objects - relavence - overruled (4:19 PM). State objects - sustained (4:20 PM). Witness excused (4:21 PM). State calls Joel Ingebrigtson, witness sworn in (4:22 PM). State directs. State offers exhibit #4 - Odometer History. Kennedy objects to court accepting exhibit - overruled (4:27 PM). Kennedy object (competant) state responds wants clarification on Kennedy objection - court addresses witness on his basis for being competant to answer to the question. Court sustains objection (4:34 pm). Kennedy cross (4:35 pm) Court witness has not given expert opinion thus far. Court questions witness on what he has reviewed for today. Witness responds to what he has reviewed for today's hearing. Not necessary for any other documents to be turned over to defense today. Kennedy continues cross. State object (argumentative) court clarification of question (witness reviews ex #4) no ruling 4:39 pm. State objection (relevance) court asks question of the witness, no ruling by court. State object sustained (4:42 pm) State object sustained (4:42 pm) State object sustained (4:43 pm) State object sustained (4:44 pm) Kennedy offers ex #6 (vehicle advertisement) State object revelancy sustained (4:46 pm) State object sustained (4:47 pm). Witness excused 4:47 pm. Deputy Justice sworn/direct by state 4:48 pm. Kennedy cross 4:53 pm. State object sustained (4:55 pm) Kennedy again asks for officers report. State responds to request for report. Kennedy reviews what State provides to him (4:56 pm) Court statement to Kennedy regarding what entails preliminary hearing. Court excuses witness (4:57 pm) Court finds that probable cause established earlier in hearing and binds over. State files INFO (mirrors). Kennedy wants to file motion to impound vehicle and have state do inspection. State doesn't know why they can't go to arraignment at this time. Court is denying defense request for impound of vehicle/testing /inspection at this time for stated reasons. Will reconsider if defense finds law. ARGN 9/14/15 @ 3 pm.
and Certificate of Appearance - JI, Odometer & Title Fraud Specialist

Houle and Kennedy have complaint, waive reading, requests PH, waives time limits. State - bond - $1000 signature bond. Court - $1000 signature bond - sets for PH.
